task_summary: A robot arm pours contents from the object in its gripper into a mug on a workbench.

task_long_description.overview: This episode shows the robot arm (SARA) in a lab workspace performing a pouring operation. The robot, already grasping the source object (likely a cup or bottle that is not visible as distinct from the gripper), moves above a mug placed centrally on the table. After aligning above the mug, the robot tilts/rotates the gripper to pour the contents, waits briefly, and then retreats. Visual context shows workspace with the mug as the target container. The main constraints are spatial alignment and avoiding spillage.
preconditions: Robot is holding a pourable object (cup/bottle)
Mug is present and unobstructed on the table
No obstacles in the pouring workspace
stepwise_plan: Ensure mug is visible or detect it
Move gripper with source object above the mug
Execute pour maneuver with suitable tilt angle
success_criteria: Liquid or contents reach the mug
failure_and_recovery: Mug not detected: repeat visual scan or report error
Spillage detected: halt pouring, alert operator
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates after pouring and retreat, or upon unrecoverable error (e.g., mug not found).

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is visible to the robot sensors.
Attempt to detect the mug if not already visible.
Move the gripper holding the source object to a position above the mug.
Pour the contents from the grasped object into the mug by tilting 90 degrees.
Wait briefly to ensure pouring action completes and liquid settles.
Move the gripper safely back from the mug after pouring.

failure_modes: Pour initiates at wrong orientation or location
Retreat collides with mug or scene
recovery_strategy: Fallback to DetectObject if mug is not visible
Retry MoveAbove with corrected alignment if unsuccessful
Abort pouring if pose error exceeds threshold
assumptions: The gripper holds a pourable source object, inferred from frames and not stated in instruction.
The actual pour source object type is ambiguous in the image and is denoted as 'gripper_object'.
No instruction about amount or pour rate; these are set to null.

expected_success_criteria: No drops or spill outside mug area
